newsitem.title: USA: Netscape plans stand-alone Navigator - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Netscape plans stand-alone Navigator - WSJ.

text.p: Netscape Communications Corp will introduce a stand-alone version of Navigator, its popular Internet-browser software, the Wall Street Journal said on Monday, citing people familiar with the situation.
Netscape officials declined to comment, pending a conference call scheduled for this morning, the paper said in its electronic edition.

According to the people, Netscape will announce that it will offer the software -- dubbed Navigator 4.0. Netscape will also announce deals for IBM and other companies, including, Novell and Sun Microsystems, to deliver the software.
The company also intends to include its new news and information product, Netcaster, with the software, the paper said the people told it.
The move is an attempt to slow inroads by Microsoft in grabbing a larger share of the market for Internet-browsing software, the paper said.
